io.jeo.data.mem

Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.data.mem.Memory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Driver<MemWorkspace>, RasterDriver<MemWorkspace>, VectorDriver<MemWorkspace>

    public class Memory
extends Object
implements VectorDriver<MemWorkspace>, RasterDriver<MemWorkspace>
    Driver for in memory workspace objects.

    Not meant to be used as a true format, mostly for testing purposes. The driver maintains a static map of Workspace objects which are loadable by NAME.

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, Boundless

    • Nested Class Summary

        public String name()
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Name identifying the driver.

        This name should be no more than a few words (ideally one). It isn't meant to be a description but should be human readable.

      • family

        public String family()
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        The family of the driver.

        This value is used to group drivers based on implementation. For example this value would indicate if the driver is based on another library that provides geo format support (GDAL, GeoTools, etc...)

        Specified by:

      • canOpen

        public boolean canOpen(Map<?,Object> opts,
              Messages messages)
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        Determines if this driver can open a connection to the data described by the specified options.

        The messages list is optionally used for the driver to report back any messages or exceptions that prevent the driver from opening the specified data source.

        Specified by:
        canOpen in interface Driver<MemWorkspace>
        Parameters:
        opts - Options describing the data.
        messages - Messages reported from the driver, optionally null.
        Returns:
        True if the driver can open the data, otherwise false.

      • canCreate

        public boolean canCreate(Map<?,Object> opts,
                Messages msgs)
        Description copied from interface: VectorDriver
        Determines if this driver can create a connection to the data described by the specified options from scratch.

        This method differs from Driver.canOpen(Map, Messages) in that it is meant to operate when a data source physically doesn't exist. It is typically used by file based drivers.

        The messages list is optionally used for the driver to report back any messages or exceptions that prevent the driver from creating the specified data source.

        Specified by:
        canCreate in interface VectorDriver<MemWorkspace>
        Parameters:
        opts - Options describing the data.
        msgs - Messages reported from the driver, optionally null.
        Returns:
        True if the driver can open the data, otherwise false.

                    throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: VectorDriver

        Parameters:
        opts - Options describing the data to connect to.
        schema - Schema to create.
        Returns:
        The data.
        Throws:
        IOException - In the event of a connection error such as a file system error or database connection failure.

      • capabilities

        public Set<Driver.Capability> capabilities()
        Description copied from interface: Driver
        The driver capabilities that declare what operations the driver is capable of handling natively.

        For example, to check if a vector driver supports bounding box queries. 

           VectorDriver drv = ...;
   if (drv.capabilities().contains(VectorDriver.BOUND)) {
       // driver supports native bbox queries
   }

        Specified by:
        capabilities in interface Driver<MemWorkspace>
